intro: Masdevallia mariposa, commonly known as the "Butterfly Orchid," is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, butterfly-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces intricate, showy blooms during the cooler months. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
